title: Trump Pardons 77, Including Giuliani and Meadows, Citing "Reconciliation"
snippets: The pardons include 77 allies tied to efforts to overturn the 2020 election, including Rudy Giuliani, former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows, and former Trump attorney Sidney Powell.
Trump pardons Giuliani, others accused of seeking to overturn his 2020 defeat Reuters
He also pardons his former White House chief of staff, Mark Meadows in a proclamation vowing to "end a grave national injustice".
Trump loyalists accused of pressuring VP Pence and organising fake electors to contest the 2020 election results.

US President Donald Trump pardonend a series of officials who supported his unfounded claims of the 2020 elections being rigged. The US administration said the pardons are part of a "national reconciliation" process.
Trump pardons Giuliani, 76 others accused of bid to overturn 2020 election Axios

Federal clemency towards president’s close allies largely symbolic as some still face legal exposure at state level Rudy Giuliani and Mark Meadows , both close former political allies of Donald Trump, are among scores of people pardoned by the president over the weekend for their roles in a plot to

U.S. President Donald Trump has pardoned his former personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani, his former chief of staff Mark Meadows and others accused of backing the Republican’s efforts to overturn the 2020 election.
Trump Pardons Giuliani, Others Over Efforts to Reverse 2020 Loss Bloomberg.com
titles: Trump grants pardons to Giuliani, Meadows, others linked to 2020 election efforts
Trump pardons Giuliani, others accused of seeking to overturn his 2020 defeat - Reuters

Trump Pardons Giuliani, Others Over Efforts to Reverse 2020 Loss - Bloomberg.com
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump issued pardons for 77 individuals, including his former personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani, former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows, and former attorney Sidney Powell. These individuals were accused of supporting Trump's unfounded claims to overturn the 2020 election results. The administration described these pardons as part of a "national reconciliation" effort. However, it's noted that despite the federal clemency, some of the pardoned individuals may still face legal challenges at the state level.

This decision comes after the Giants continued to struggle, notably blowing another double-digit lead against Chicago. Mike Tomlin has been mentioned as a potential replacement, while Mike Kafka has also garnered interest for head coaching roles.

title: Car Explosion Near Red Fort in New Delhi Kills 8, Injures 20
snippets: A car exploded near the 17th century Red Fort in New Delhi on Monday, killing at least eight people, injuring others and triggering a fire that damaged vehicles parked nearby, New Delhi police said.
Eight killed in car explosion near Red Fort in India's Delhi Reuters
Twenty more were injured in the blast, the cause of which is still unknown, authorities say.
Car blast near New Delhi’s historic Red Fort kills at least 8 people, India’s police say AP News
Local television channels report at least 20 people wounded in the blast.
India’s top security official said the cause of the blast, near the Red Fort in the capital, was still being investigated.

At least eight people were killed on Monday in a car explosion near the historic Red Fort in a densely populated area of the Indian capital of New Delhi, a police spokesperson said. It was a rare blast in the heavily guarded city of more than 30 million people.
titles: Car explosion near Red Fort in India's capital kills at least 8 people, police say

summary: A car explosion near the Red Fort in New Delhi, India, on Monday resulted in at least eight fatalities and injured around 20 people. The incident also caused a fire, damaging nearby vehicles. The cause of the explosion is currently under investigation. This event marks a rare occurrence in the heavily guarded capital, which is home to over 30 million residents.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Kim Davis' Appeal Against Same-Sex Marriage
snippets: The challenge to the court's 2015 ruling came from Kim Davis, the former Kentucky clerk who refused to issue same-sex licenses after the court's Obergefell v. Hodges decision, which recognized a constitutional right to same-sex marriage.
Supreme Court rejects call to overturn its decision legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide AP News
Supreme Court rejects challenge to gay marriage decision Axios
The Supreme Court turned away an appeal from a former Kentucky court clerk who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples after the Supreme Court's 2015 ruling.

The U.S. Supreme Court rejected on Monday a bid by a former Kentucky county official to overturn its landmark 2015 ruling legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide, as the justices steered clear of the contentious case some 3-1/2 years after its conservative majority reversed abortion rights.
Supreme Court Rejects Bid to Overturn Same-Sex Marriage Rights Bloomberg.com

summary: The U.S. Supreme Court declined an appeal from Kim Davis, a former Kentucky clerk, to overturn the 2015 decision legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide. Davis had refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples following the Court's Obergefell v. Hodges ruling. This rejection maintains the legal status of same-sex marriage across the United States.

Al-Sharaa, who rose to power after ousting Bashar al-Assad and has a history with al-Qaeda, aims to discuss the full lifting of sanctions imposed during Syria's 13-year civil war.

title: Canada Loses Measles Elimination Status Amid Outbreak
snippets: Canada loses measles elimination status after three decades Reuters
A large, ongoing outbreak that began in Canada in 2024 has cost the country its measles elimination status.
Canada virtually eliminated measles in 1998. Now, a disease that doctors in the country knew only from textbooks is back.
The disease was once considered eliminated in Canada, but not any more — there have been more than 5,000 cases in the last 12 months as vaccination rates have fallen.
Measles is the most contagious infectious disease known to mankind, but the measles vaccine is highly effective at preventing it.

TORONTO — Canada has officially lost the measles elimination status it had held since 1998, causing the entire region of the Americas to also lose the designation. The status is granted and revoked by the Pan American Health Organization, the World Health Organization’s office for countries in North
Canada Loses Measles-Free Status With Outbreak Passing One-Year Mark Bloomberg.com
titles: Canada loses measles elimination status after three decades - Reuters
Canada has lost its 'measles elimination status' — here's what that means

'Embarrassing and sad': Canada loses measles elimination status after nearly 30 years
Canada loses measles elimination status, causing entire region to lose designation
Canada Loses Measles-Free Status With Outbreak Passing One-Year Mark - Bloomberg.com
summary: Canada has lost its measles elimination status, a designation held since 1998, due to an ongoing outbreak with over 5,000 cases in the past year. The resurgence, attributed to declining vaccination rates, marks the return of a disease once virtually eradicated in the country. This loss also affects the measles-free status of the Americas, as confirmed by the Pan American Health Organization.

The storm hit the Philippines, killing at least four people and displacing more than 1.4 million others.

Grabbing children and leaving their homes behind, residents evacuated before Typhoon Fung-wong hit.

The storm resulted in at least four fatalities and displaced over 1.4 million people. The typhoon, which made landfall on the northeastern coast of Luzon, weakened as it moved away from the Philippines.

Lewis Hamilton and Charles Leclerc need to “focus on driving and talk less,” Ferrari executive chairman John Elkann warned Monday after both of the team’s drivers failed to finish the Brazilian Grand Prix.

title: Sarkozy Released After 3 Weeks, Appeals Gaddafi Funding Conviction
snippets: The former French president was jailed in October for conspiring to fund his election campaign with money from late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi.
Sarkozy was found guilty of criminal conspiracy for his role in securing funding for his 2007 presidential campaign.

summary: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy was convicted of criminal conspiracy for securing illegal funding from Muammar Gaddafi for his 2007 campaign. After serving three weeks of a five-year sentence, Sarkozy was released to serve the remainder pending appeal. He has expressed a desire to prove his innocence, describing his time in jail as a ‘nightmare’.

title: Basketball Legend Lenny Wilkens Dies at 88
snippets: Lenny Wilkens, a three-time inductee into the Basketball Hall of Fame who was enshrined as both a player and a coach, has died, his family said Sunday. He was 88. The family said Wilkens was surrounded by loved ones when he died and did not immediately release a cause of death.
Lenny Wilkens Dies at 88, Hall of Famer Won 1979 NBA Title as SuperSonics HC Bleacher Report

SEATTLE — Lenny Wilkens, a three-time inductee into the Basketball Hall of Fame who was enshrined as both a player and a coach, has died, his family said Sunday. He was 88. The family said Wilkens was surrounded by loved ones when he died and did not immediately release a cause of death. Wilkens was one of the finest point guards of his era who later brought his calm and savvy style to the sideline, first as a player-coach and then evolving into one of the game’s great coaches. He coached 2,487 games in the NBA, which is still a record. He became a Hall of Famer as a player, as a coach and...
titles: Hall of Famer and former Raptors coach Lenny Wilkens dies at 88
Lenny Wilkens Dies at 88, Hall of Famer Won 1979 NBA Title as SuperSonics HC - Bleacher Report
Former Raptors head coach Lenny Wilkens dead at 88
summary: Lenny Wilkens, a celebrated figure in basketball known for his distinguished career as both a player and a coach, has passed away at the age of 88. His family confirmed his death, stating he was surrounded by loved ones, but did not provide a cause of death. Wilkens was a three-time inductee into the Basketball Hall of Fame, recognized for his achievements on the court as a point guard and on the sidelines as a coach. He holds the record for coaching 2,487 NBA games.

summary: The Trump administration has ordered states to reverse actions that provided full SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program) benefits to low-income families amid the government shutdown. This directive affects 42 million Americans dependent on food stamps. The decision, enforced through potential financial penalties for non-compliance, follows a Supreme Court stay on lower court rulings that had allowed the benefits. This move has sparked concerns over the potential catastrophic impact on those reliant on the program during the shutdown.
